channel.title: For unlocked topics please learn how to ask a question![Updated 9/28/08]
channel.description:
This means be specific, State what you want clearly, and show the attempts you have made to finding your answer.
http://catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html
[b]Edit by TeleNubby:[/b] It seems as if you guys are not understanding the message and meaning behind this post. Therefore, I will elaborate for you.
When you ask a question, pretend we are seven-year-old kids (that's very easy to do as most of you guys are) that have no idea what's going on. That's how much you'll have to explain. When asking the question, you must clearly ask it, just like Silabsoft said. This means use proper grammer and spelling, as this makes our job easier, and make sure you're question is understandable.
Next, you'll have to show us what you've already done. [b]THIS IS A MUST![/b] If we want to get anywhere as a community, we're going to have to quit the spoon-feeding. So if you ask something like "how do I get food healing to work" and show us no previous attempts, you're not going to get an answer. You may be wondering how a question like this is considered bad. Well, the question asker did not make an attempt to solve the problem him or herself, and is indirectly asking the same question as "tell me how to get food healing work so I can continue my effortless server." So, remember, [b]show us what you've done, what you've tried to do, or what you think may work.[/b]
After you have all of that, you'll have to identify the problem. Its not our job to add your snippet into our own servers and test it for any inconveniences, its YOURS. Usually, its a compilation problem, and it can be solved very easily by glancing at the JavaDocs. Something like [i]NullPointerException[/i] can be found by typing [i]NullPointerException java.sun[/i] in the Google search bar. This will return results with links to the JavaDocs about your problem.
Remember, this is just the bare minimum. Try and keep your questions as elaborate as possible. This will benefit yourself and the community as a whole, as you will be learning in the process and we will be able to help solve your problem faster.
Edit: Seeing as most of you think this is a joke, warnings will now be handed out if you disobey this.

[quote=“Crazycrud121, post:21, topic:202972”]I need help Do you think You could Help me make a Server to.

I have been trying to make one for the last Week.

I have seen all the Guides/ Youtube Videos.

What I really want is Someone that can actually Tell my step by step how to make one.

P.S. Please look at my Topic Called " 10 Questions on how to make a server… May help you.

P.S.S. If you could help me make one That would be very appreciated.

  • Crazycrud121[/quote]

…wonderful spaaaaaam! Well, for this one actually, it’s just in the wrong place - not exactly spam.

And I love it how some of you in this thread sound like my English teacher. His surname is Pickles (just thought you might like to know - to enlighten your day).

@Rog3r wrote:

[quote=“MOth Force THru window, post:26, topic:202972”]Lol Miss Silabsoft got OWNT :::: Miss Silabsoft:" This means use proper grammer and spelling, as this makes our job easier, and make sure you’re question is understandable."

ITS CALLED GRAMMAR…

G-R-A-M-M-A-R

http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/grammer THIS IS MISS SILABSOFT AND TELE(noob) (TELENUBBY)
http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/grammar FOR PEOPLE THAT CAN ACTUALLY SPELL.

gram·mar –noun 1. the study of the way the sentences of a language are constructed; morphology and syntax.
2. these features or constructions themselves: English grammar

===========
gram-mer -noun 1. THERE ISNT A NOUN 1 SORRY.

OWNED.[/quote]

You made yourself more stupid

item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Where’s the period at the end of the sentence?

It’s not a sentence since it doesn’t begin with a capital letter or conclude with a full stop.

You said: “Where’s the period at the end of the sentence?” Which would imply that there already is a period at the end of it - which there isn’t. That’s like saying, “Where’s my ball in the garden?”

Read full topic
